poem:
Title: 'Image within the Newsprint'

Breathless, apologetic, in the margins - 
the words 'far right' fade from the script. 
Reform UK, an onion peeled by the light,  
brittle layers of culture, climate, angst, 
stripped away, revealing raw core-  
an anti-immigration gaze. 

No simple labels to cloak the politics, merely 
shimmering truths in dappled ink - 
a story, rewritten, 
still full of complexities.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Reform UK, which blends an anti-immigration message with other rightwing positions in areas including culture and the climate crisis,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
